questions.text: I trust people more when they show consistent logic and honesty.
I feel safest when roles and boundaries are clear.
I remember what matters to people and track it over time.
I can create a bridge between different personalities without losing myself.
I struggle to relax unless I’m in control of what happens next.
I feel loved when I’m needed, even if it drains me.
I keep distance because belonging often comes with disappointment.
I present my best version so people won’t see what I fear is unworthy.
I build trust through doing—showing up, fixing, making, completing.
I feel deeply, and it affects how close I let people get.
I often sense someone’s intentions before they say them.
I watch people’s patterns carefully to know whether they’re safe.
I assume closeness will eventually lead to pain, so I stay prepared.
When I care, I hide it under calmness and control.
I become whoever others need so they won’t leave.
